title: Executive Order reinstates Schedule F-style classification for policy roles
summary: Reinstates and amends EO 13957 (Schedule F), enabling at-will reclassification of policy-influencing positions.

title: National Security Memorandum directs DOJ to broaden domestic terrorism guidance
summary: Orders DOJ to include behaviors like organized doxing, swatting, civil disorder and property crimes in domestic terrorism priorities.

title: Administration requests 100 U.S. troops for Illinois amid enforcement push
summary: Governor says DHS memo sought troop deployment to protect federal personnel and facilities during stepped-up operations.

title: Authorization of 200 National Guard members for Portland deployment
summary: State and local leaders challenge the planned deployment; legal and civil-military questions raised.

title: Unions and lawmakers move to block civil service overhaul
summary: Opposition to Schedule-style reclassification framework; litigation and legislation discussed.

title: Portland councilor, Army veteran, urges troops to reject deployment
summary: Local official calls deployment unlawful and inappropriate, highlighting civil-military tension.

title: ICE publishes 2025 National Detention Standards update
summary: Agency revises detention standards; civil liberties groups scrutinize implications for detainee rights.

title: Legal analysis: NSPM targets funders and coordinators via JTTF/NJTTF
summary: Explains how DOJ/JTTFs may investigate organizations and funders associated with 'political violence' as defined in the memorandum.

summary.title: Administration strips security clearances from 51 former intel officials
summary.summary: Action taken within first week; positioned publicly as part of campaign promises of 'retribution.'

summary.title: OPM hiring plan called a 'blatant loyalty test' by workforce experts
summary.summary: New application prompts and Schedule-style changes seen as politicizing hiring toward presidential loyalty.

summary.title: Push to 'reward loyalty' in civil service accelerates
summary.summary: Reporting documents efforts to condition hiring/retention on loyalty rather than merit.

summary.title: Justice Department indicts former FBI Director James Comey
summary.summary: AP coverage situates the case within a broader 'retribution' push against longtime critics.

summary.title: President suggests DOJ is investigating former FBI Director Wray
summary.summary: Public remarks hint at targeting another former FBI chief; follows Comey charges.

summary.title: Reported firing of national security staff after activist presents 'disloyalty' dossiers
summary.summary: Post-meeting dismissals framed as rooting out disloyalty inside the administration.

summary.title: White House fact sheet pledges to 'root out disloyalty'
summary.summary: Primary source rhetoric establishing 'disloyalty' as grounds for punitive action.
